intro: Aster brachytrichus var. angustisquamus, commonly known as narrowleaf aster, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of blue to purple, which bloom in late summer to early fall. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils. This species is often found in open woodlands and prairies, contributing to local biodiversity.
